Content:
### C.O.R.E: Your digital brain for the AI era

Documentation â€¢ Discord

## ğŸ§  C.O.R.E. **Contextual Observation & Recall Engine** C.O.R.E is a portable memory graph built from your llm interactions and personal data, making all your context and workflow history accessible to any AI tool, just like a digital brain. This eliminates the need for repeated context sharing . The aim is to provide: - **Unified, Portable Memory**: Add and recall context seamlessly, and connect your memory across apps like Claude, Cursor, Windsurf and more. - **Relational, Not just Flat Facts**: CORE organizes your knowledge, storing both facts and relationships for a deeper richer memory like a real brain. - **User Owned**: You decide what to keep, update or delete and share your memory across the tool you want and be freed from vendor lock-in. ## ğŸ¥ Demo Video [Check C.O.R.E Demo](https://youtu.be/iANZ32dnK60) ## ğŸ§© Key Features - **Memory Graph**: Visualise how your facts and preferences link together - **Chat with Memory**: Ask questions about memory for instant insights and understanding - **Plug n Play**: Instantly use CORE memory in apps like Cursor, Claude ## â˜ï¸ C.O.R.E Cloud Setup 1. Sign up to [Core Cloud](https://core.heysol.ai) and start building your memory graph. 2. Add your text that you want to save in memory. Once clicking on `+ Add` button your memory graph will be generated. 3. [Connect Core Memory MCP with Cursor](#connecting-core-mcp-with-cursor) ## ğŸ’» C.O.R.E Local Setup #### Prerequisites 1. Docker 2. OpenAI API Key > **Note:** We are actively working on improving support for Llama models. At the moment, C.O.R.E does not provide optimal results with Llama-based models, but we are making progress to ensure better compatibility and output in the near future. > #### Run C.O.R.E locally 1. **Copy Environment Variables** Copy the example environment file to `.env`:

OpenAI APIã‚­ãƒ¼ > **æ³¨æ„:** Llamaãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã®ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆå‘ä¸Šã«ç©æ¥µçš„ã«å–ã‚Šçµ„ã‚“ã§ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ç¾çŠ¶ã§ã¯Llamaãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã®ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã§ã¯æœ€é©ãªçµæœãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ãŒã€è¿‘ã„å°†æ¥ã‚ˆã‚Šè‰¯ã„äº’æ›æ€§ã¨å‡ºåŠ›ã‚’å®Ÿç¾ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚é€²è¡Œä¸­ã§ã™ã€‚ > #### C.O.R.Eã‚’ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ«ã§å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ 1. **ç’°å¢ƒå¤‰æ•°ã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼** ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ç’°å¢ƒãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’`.env`ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ï¼š

RowTranslations.originContent: ### C.O.R.E: Your digital brain for the AI era

C.O.R.E is a portable memory graph built from your llm interactions and personal data, making all your context and workflow history accessible to any AI tool, just like a digital brain. This eliminates the need for repeated context sharing . The aim is to provide:
- **Unified, Portable Memory**: Add and recall context seamlessly, and connect your memory across apps like Claude, Cursor, Windsurf and more.
- **Relational, Not just Flat Facts**: CORE organizes your knowledge, storing both facts and relationships for a deeper richer memory like a real brain.
- **User Owned**: You decide what to keep, update or delete and share your memory across the tool you want and be freed from vendor lock-in.
- **Memory Graph**: Visualise how your facts and preferences link together
- **Chat with Memory**: Ask questions about memory for instant insights and understanding
- **Plug n Play**: Instantly use CORE memory in apps like Cursor, Claude
1. Sign up to [Core Cloud](https://core.heysol.ai) and start building your memory graph.
2. Add your text that you want to save in memory. Once clicking on `+ Add` button your memory graph will be generated.

> **Note:** We are actively working on improving support for Llama models. At the moment, C.O.R.E does not provide optimal results with Llama-based models, but we are making progress to ensure better compatibility and output in the near future.
Copy the example environment file to `.env`:

Content:
2. **Start the Application**

   Use Docker Compose to start all required services:

RowTranslations.originContent: Use Docker Compose to start all required services:

Content: 3. **Access the App** Once the containers are running, open your browser and go to [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000). 4. **Create Account with Magic Link** - To Create an account, click on `Continue with email` button - Enter your email and click on `Send a Magic Link` button - `Copy the magic link from terminal logs` and open it in your browser 5. **Create Your Private Space & Add Data** - In the dashboard, go to the top right section -> Type a message, e.g., `I love playing badminton`, and click `+Add`. - Your memory is queued for processing; you can monitor its status in the `Logs` section. - Once processing is complete, nodes will be added to your private knowledge graph and visible in the dashboard. - You can later choose to connect this memory to other tools or keep it private. 6. **Search Your Memory** - Use the dashboard's search feature to query your ingested data within your private space. ## Connecting CORE MCP with Cursor 1. Open the CORE dashboard and navigate to the API section to generate a new API token. 2. In Cursor, go to: Settings â†’ Tools & Integrations â†’ New MCP Server. 3. Add the CORE MCP server using the configuration format below. Be sure to replace the API_TOKEN value with the token you generated in step 1. MCP configuration to add in Cursor
Translation: 3. **ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã«ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹** ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒŠãŒèµ·å‹•ã—ãŸã‚‰ã€ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ã‚¶ã‚’é–‹ã [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ã«ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ 4. **ãƒã‚¸ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã§ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹** - ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€`Continue with email` ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¾ã™ - ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ã‚¹ã‚’å…¥åŠ›ã—ã€`Send a Magic Link` ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¾ã™ - `ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã®ãƒ­ã‚°ã‹ã‚‰ãƒã‚¸ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼`ã—ã€ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ã‚¶ã§é–‹ãã¾ã™ 5. **ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹** - ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®å³ä¸Šã‚»ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¸ç§»å‹•ã—ã€ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’å…¥åŠ›ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ä¾‹ï¼š`I love playing badminton`ã€ãã—ã¦ `+Add` ã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ - ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªã¯å‡¦ç†å¾…ã¡ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã«å…¥ã‚Šã€ãã®ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ã¯ `Logs` ã‚»ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã§ç¢ºèªã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ - å‡¦ç†ãŒå®Œäº†ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒŠãƒ¬ãƒƒã‚¸ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã«è¿½åŠ ã•ã‚Œã€ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ - å¾Œã§ã“ã®ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªã‚’ä»–ã®ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨é€£æºã™ã‚‹ã‹ã€éå…¬é–‹ã®ã¾ã¾ã«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ 6. **ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªã‚’æ¤œç´¢ã™ã‚‹** - ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®æ¤œç´¢æ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’ä½¿ã„ã€ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¹å†…ã®å–ã‚Šè¾¼ã‚“ã ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒªã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ ## CORE MCPã¨Cursorã®æ¥ç¶š 1. COREãƒ€ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’é–‹ãã€APIã‚»ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã«ç§»å‹•ã—ã¦æ–°ã—ã„APIãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ 2. Cursorã§ã¯ã€è¨­å®š â†’ ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨çµ±åˆ â†’ æ–°è¦MCPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ã«ç§»å‹•ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ 3. ä»¥ä¸‹ã®æ§‹æˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦CORE MCPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—1ã§ç”Ÿæˆã—ãŸAPIãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’API_TOKENå€¤ã«å¿…ãšç½®ãæ›ãˆã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ Cursorã«è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹MCPæ§‹æˆ

RowTranslations.originContent: Once the containers are running, open your browser and go to [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000).
- To Create an account, click on `Continue with email` button
- Enter your email and click on `Send a Magic Link` button
- `Copy the magic link from terminal logs` and open it in your browser
- In the dashboard, go to the top right section -> Type a message, e.g., `I love playing badminton`, and click `+Add`.
- Your memory is queued for processing; you can monitor its status in the `Logs` section.
- Once processing is complete, nodes will be added to your private knowledge graph and visible in the dashboard.
- You can later choose to connect this memory to other tools or keep it private.
- Use the dashboard's search feature to query your ingested data within your private space.
1. Open the CORE dashboard and navigate to the API section to generate a new API token.
2. In Cursor, go to: Settings â†’ Tools & Integrations â†’ New MCP Server.
3. Add the CORE MCP server using the configuration format below. Be sure to replace the API_TOKEN value with the token you generated in step 1.
MCP configuration to add in Cursor

Content: 4. Go to Settings-> User rules -> New Rule -> and add the below rule to ensure all your chat interactions are being stored in CORE memory

RowTranslations.originContent: 4. Go to Settings-> User rules -> New Rule -> and add the below rule to ensure all your chat interactions are being stored in CORE memory

Content:
```
After every interaction, update the memory with the user's query and the assistant's
response to core-memory mcp. sessionId should be the uuid of the conversation
```
Translation:
```
After every interaction, update the memory with the user's query and the assistant's
response to core-memory mcp. sessionId should be the uuid of the conversation
```

Content: ## Documentation Explore our documentation to get the most out of CORE - [Basic Concepts](https://docs.heysol.ai/core/overview) - [API Reference](https://docs.heysol.ai/core/local-setup) - [Connect Core Memory MCP with Cursor](#connecting-core-mcp-with-cursor) ## ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Support Have questions or feedback? We're here to help: - Discord: [Join core-support channel](https://discord.gg/YGUZcvDjUa) - Documentation: [docs.heysol.ai/core](https://docs.heysol.ai/core/overview) - Email: manik@poozle.dev ## Usage Guidelines **Store:** - Conversation history - User preferences - Task context - Reference materials **Don't Store:** - Sensitive data (PII) - Credentials - System logs - Temporary data ## ğŸ‘¥ Contributors
